intro: Adonanthe vernalis, commonly known as the spring beauty, is a delicate flowering plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist, shady woodlands and thrives in cool, temperate climates. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in early spring. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, which help retain moisture. Adonanthe vernalis is a member of the Primulaceae family and is valued for its early bloom and ecological importance to pollinators.
